ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English 'sapling', formed from 'sap' (referring to the vital fluid of plants) + '-ling' (a diminutive suffix indicating a small or young version of something).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A young tree, especially one with a slender trunk and no more than a few branches.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 幼树；树苗，小树（特指树干细长、枝叶不多的幼年树木）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We planted a small sapling in the garden, hoping it would grow into a mighty oak.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们在花园里种了一棵小树苗，希望它能长成一棵参天大橡树。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (比喻) 年轻人；乳臭未干的年轻人；未经世故的人
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The young sapling of a knight still had much to learn before he could lead an army.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位年轻的骑士学徒在能够率领军队之前还有很多东西要学习。
